channel.title: Dug Song on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Dug Song on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: mitmproxy
item.description: In his An internet x-ray machine for the masses, Paul Ohm writes a lucid introduction to mitmproxy, a man-in-the-middle proxy server that allows you to get between your browser and the Internet and poke at (and change) the traffic going between the two. http://mitmproxy.org is the home of mitmproxy. It’s the work of Aldo Cortesi and a cast of hundreds of contributors on github at https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy . I used the OS X binary distribution from the download page.

item.title: Dug Song's letter to the Ann Arbor News endorsing Kirk Westphal, annotated
item.description: Dug Song wrote a letter to the editor of the Ann Arbor News which was published on Sunday, 27 October 2013. It is annotated here with the hyperlinks to a variety of sources for further reading. The letter includes a political endorsement. While I deeply appreciate city council's dedication to a balanced budget and basic services, we cannot simply save our way to success. Post-Pfizer, Ann Arbor must increase its tax base by supporting a strong and diversified economy of high-growth, high tech companies.
